intro: Aconitum pulchellum, commonly known as the alpine aconite, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems that can reach up to 1.5 meters in height. The plant produces striking blue to purple flowers in late summer, which are arranged in dense clusters at the top of the stem. Its leaves are palmately compound, with deeply lobed segments that are covered in soft, velvety hairs. Aconitum pulchellum is adapted to cool, moist environments and thrives in well-drained soils at high altitudes.
